author: Simon Difford
description: Depending on the ripeness of your grapes, and the sweetness of your palate, you may want to stretch to half a shot sugar syrup. Strike the right balance and you’ll be rewarded with a medley of white grapes, white wine and botanical gin freshness with faint, cleansing zesty citrus.
name: La Vendangeuse
recipeIngredient: 45 ml Lillet Blanc (or other aromatized wine)
10 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°brix)

recipeInstructions.text: MUDDLE grapes in base of shaker
Add other ingredients, SHAKE with ice and fine strain into chilled glass
